intro: Corydalis elegans subsp. robusta, commonly known as the robust corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable candidate for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its early spring blooming habit and unique floral structure.
